column1: Painful menstrual periods are periods in which a woman has crampy lower abdominal pain, sharp or aching pain that comes and goes, or possibly back pain.
Painful menstruation is the leading cause of lost time from school and work among women in their teens and 20s.

Painful menstrual periods fall into two groups, depending on the cause: - Primary dysmenorrhea - Secondary dysmenorrhea Primary dysmenorrhea is menstrual pain that occurs around the time that menstrual periods first begin in otherwise healthy young women.
Secondary dysmenorrhea is menstrual pain that develops later in women who have had normal periods.
